definition: to discuss together/to try to reach a common judgment/panel discussion
100 ml/one-tenth of a peck/measure for dry grain equal to one-tenth of sheng 升 or liter, or one-hundredth dou 斗
to close/to join/to fit/to be equal to/whole/together/round (in battle)/conjunction (astronomy)/1st note of pentatonic scale/old variant of 盒[he2]
variant of 合[he2]
to comment on/to discuss/to suggest
(law) collegiate bench/panel of judges

sentences.english: The members of a collegial panel shall be odd in number.
sentences.chinese: 合议庭的成员人数应当是单数。

sentences.english: The deliberations shall be recorded in writing, and the transcript shall be signed by the members of the collegial panel.
sentences.chinese: 评议应当制作笔录，由合议庭成员签名。

sentences.english: Article 26 The collegial system shall be applied in the trial of compensation cases.
sentences.chinese: 第二十六条审理赔偿案件实行合议制。

sentences.english: The people's court shall form a new collegial panel for the purpose of the retrial.
sentences.chinese: 人民法院审理再审案件，应当另行组成合议庭。

sentences.english: The penalization of cases should respect the opinions of the entire court.
sentences.chinese: 案件的判罚要尊重合议庭的意见。

sentences.english: The parties concerned in the case shall be notified the change of collegiate members.
sentences.chinese: 合议庭成员的更换情况应当及时通知诉讼当事人。

sentences.english: And second, in support of the first, relationships between teachers and students are very collegial .
sentences.chinese: 第二，支持首之间的关系，教师和学生都是非常合议。

sentences.english: No man of the party against which an application is filed may become a collegiate member.
sentences.chinese: 被申请人所属人员不得担任合议人员。

sentences.english: In civil cases of second instance in the people's court, justice is administered by a collegiate bench made up of judges.
sentences.chinese: 人民法院审理第二审民事案件，由审判员组成合议庭。

sentences.english: The number of members of a collegial panel shall be an odd number of three or more.
sentences.chinese: 合议庭的成员，应当是三人以上的单数。

sentences.english: The judge states collegiate bench closes this case adjudicates choose an auspicious day after discussing.
sentences.chinese: 法官表示合议庭合议后将择日宣判此案。

sentences.english: The judge states collegiate bench closes this case adjudicates choose an auspicious day after discussing.
sentences.chinese: 法官表示合议庭合议后将择日宣判此案。

sentences.english: The collegiate bench investigates to Zhang the relative, knew that Zhang the father spirit is not normal.
sentences.chinese: 合议庭又向张某亲属调查，得知张某之父精神不正常。

definition: (law) collegiate bench/panel of judges
to hear (a case)
to appraise through discussion
to attend court/to take part in a trial
to hear a case again/review/retrial
to commit sb for trial/to bring sb for interrogation
jury
to reach an agreement/to agree upon
public trial (in a court of law)
to re-investigate/to investigate and reconsider a judgment
to reject/to turn down/to overrule
joint hearing/to review jointly (i.e. with other checkers)
examination of the evidence of the opposing party in a court of law
public decision (by ballot)/majority decision/a joint decision/referendum
to reach a verdict/to conclude a judgment
to negotiate/discussion/proposal
